website_summaries.verdict: Cooking in a cast iron skillet isn't for everyone, but this roomy cast iron skillet from a quality maker is great for both fans and novices.
pros: A solid cast iron skillet with traditional construction by a top manufacturer
cons: A few owners complain about defective pans with misshapen bottoms
Requires a learning curve for those who are new to cooking in cast iron

customer_reviews.title: Product defect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I have a smaller lodge cast iron pan for years which I love and wanted a larger one to complement. However four months after purchase as I was heating up olive oil on medium High temp , while I was in the kitchen dicing gArlic for it , I heard what sounded like a gunshot and found that the pan split in two. Photo attached. Unfortunately it's past the return date. I'm disappointed because I had good experience with this product before and no explanation as to how a few minutes of heat could cause fracture. Had to toss the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come properly preseasoned
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a good pan and I got it at a great price. I kind of regret getting the 13inch one because it is much bigger and heavier than expected, but would be good to prepare foods for larger gatherings. The reason I won't give it the full 5 stars is because this did not come properly preseasoned. Food stuck to the bottom and the sides so I will have to season it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Antsy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cast iron. As with all cast iron cookware the key is keeping them seasoned properly. Once seasoned you must watch how you wash them, (no dish washer, no soap, only hot water and a nylon scrubber works best for me) and re-season them after washing. Once you get the hang of it, it becomes second nature. Cooking with cast iron will also add dietary iron to your meals. I am low in iron but cannot take iron supplements as they upset my stomach. But cooking in cast iron helps keep my iron levels up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love the size and versatility
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a really large pan for a while and am very happy with this one. I really like the versatility of being able to put it in the oven, even a campfire. Even though it's bigger than my stove burner, it heats evenly. The biggest strength is also the biggest weakness, and that is its size. It's heavy even when empty, so keep that in mind. It's worth it to me though.
customer_reviews.author: EricaJo

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This pan had a very rough surface which made me wonder how foods would move around on it. Not well is the answer. I treated it with oil in the oven for seasoning but seasoning is not the problem. The rough surface is not like my other cast iron pan I bought 46 years ago (still going strong) and the Victoria pan I just bought on Amazon. I gave the lodge pan away today.
customer_reviews.author: S. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Like Losge
customer_reviews.text: Have had Lodge skillets before but, this one seems extra heavy. It does seem extra stout so that explains the weight. Personally, I am not a fan of new “non stick” coating. Sticky out of the box and continues to be so. Surface is a little rough. I prefer to season older and smoother Lodge skillets. Still a good value for the price. I intend to buff mine smooth though. Nothing Works as good as cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo 223

customer_reviews.title: Move over range top only cookware there's a new skillet in town!
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of cast iron! Most notably Lodge cast iron as it comes to you without residue because it has already been seasoned almost to perfection. Now that I have a bigger cast iron for making marvelous hashbrown skillet meals (cook one side shredded hashbrowns, turn them over and while bottom is cooking crack some whole eggs on top and add spinach, mushrooms, sweet peppers, cheese, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper. Turn off heat and pop into the oven on 300 for 10 - 15 minutes) I won't have to make two pans worth. Plus I can throw out the big, not oven friendly, warped wreck of a 13" skillet that I can't stand.
customer_reviews.author: Charise M. Westphal

customer_reviews.title: Item as described and a great sized skillet when you're cooking for 3+ people.
customer_reviews.text: Just what you'd expect from a Lodge. This skillet is so large that I can put this across two burners on our stovetop. It's nice having the extra surface space to cook things like several eggs without having them all bunched up. Or, I can cook pancakes and eggs on the same surface at the same time. Only thing with this size is that it's very heavy. I expected that but some might not anticipate the weight if they haven't used cast iron before. These skillets last forever as long as you don't completely abuse it so I expect to use it for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: KJ in SD

customer_reviews.title: Pound a big nail into a stud and hang this pan to make your kitchen look cool. Throw away the teflon and your plastic spatulas .
customer_reviews.text: I cook almost exclusively on my stovetop and in my oven with cast iron. I needed an extra large frying pan and this one exceeded my expectations. The workmanship, design and feel is outstanding. It conducts heat very well and the cooking surface is that rough perfection that releases the food and brings out the flavor. Pound a big nail into a stud and hang this pan to make your kitchen look cool. Throw away the teflon and your plastic spatulas and go back to the future.
customer_reviews.author: Best To You

customer_reviews.title: Very big
customer_reviews.text: It is sooooooooooo big! I bought it so I could cook more then 2 pieces of meat at a time (other cast iron is much smaller). It is very nice though and makes great pork chops or a baked ziti. It is quite heavy though and I have a lot of trouble lifting it to drain, if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: O'Doherty FamilyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little TLC but replaced 70% of my pans with this
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time and work to break in new cast iron but this pan is wonderful. Its cast iron so its not easy but once you learn it and get to know what you are doing its wonderful. Caramel onions, burgers, mushrooms, fond, you name it. I don't take any other pots out of my cabinet unless I'm doing sauces or boiling noodles now
customer_reviews.author: J Kietchzkavitch

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: I love this guy, its big, and heavy, and everything you expect. However my burner is 10 inches and this is a big 14 inch skillet does not get even distribution of heat. I do not know if I am doing something wrong but its not the best as even distribution of heat. I still use it everyday though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A.

customer_reviews.title: This is what A frying pan should be like.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic large skillet. I remember my grandmother cooking with all the Different sizes. First thing I cook with it was fried chicken it honestly made the best fried chicken I’ve ever prepared. It wasn’t greasy and it fried the chicken Perfectly. Cleaning also was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Perreira

customer_reviews.title: the pre seasoning is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I underestimated how big this thing was haha. It's huge. Too big for my apartment stovetop so I threw it in my camping box and got a smaller one for the stove. Both work extremely well, whether it's on a fire while camping, or a stovetop. The heat is spread evenly. It took a long time to season it myself...the pre seasoning is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Papagiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan as it can be used just for the two of us as we make more for another meal or we can use it when our kids are home with their families. Thanks! (I also ordered the cast iron cleaning kit that also comes with a silicone handle to go over this pans handle. Very useful)
customer_reviews.author: Caseeih

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron can not be beat I like the nutritional iron that my bamboo spatula scraps off and mixes with the eggs I cook.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but then again what can I say? It is a cast iron skillet and cast iron skillets are what I came into this world knowing then moving onto stainless, aluminum, Pyrex, and various chemical coated pans, eventually making a full circle to the start. I have cooked several meals with it already now that most have been satisfactory but that culpability can't be on the skillet rather my own nascent yet food sticking cooking. I have never been to good yet strive on because of desire and guilt at eating at Wendy's everyday for a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: SmokingChicken

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a substantial pan, very heavy, but that is what we wanted. We compared the weights of the two similarly sized Lodge pans and opted for this one. We use it for everything, steaks and burgers, breakfast, it’s an awesome pan. Comes seasoned, easy to clean and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Really useful in addition to normal pots and pans!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using it. A great size for cooking a good amount. Be careful just to use a medium heat and cook patiently. Be careful if you have stone countertops. It’s extremely sturdy and heavy so will chip edges if you’re not paying attention!
customer_reviews.author: David J. Wickes

customer_reviews.title: Large pan for large cooking
customer_reviews.text: Lodge iron skillets are the best and more importantly they are made in the USA. I have used this skillet several times now. I am pleased with its performance. Did not buy a lid for it as I already have large lids that will work with this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Don I

customer_reviews.title: Why would I ever have to buy another pan
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid to use Cast Iron thinking everything would stick or it would not do the job. But it is the best pan I've ever owned. We use it for all kinds of recipes. Last night cooked chili in it, cleaned it out and then put in two pork tenderloins to brown them in the pan and just put the whole thing in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: robert thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best skillet
customer_reviews.text: The best skillet ever. I would buy it a zillion times again but won’t need to cause it will last a lifetime. Enjoying cooking so many different things just taste way better when using skillet. Price was good and delivery was on time.
customer_reviews.author: Lemds

customer_reviews.title: Very large and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time lifting the skillet. Even my husband felt it was very heavy. I had no problem cleaning it up after fried potatoes and sausage or biscuits and gravy. If I ordered again I would order a size down. Love the pan.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE R.

customer_reviews.title: Great skillet, sears, frys, simmers whatever you want.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this skillet. It's very large & will fry an entire big chicken. I can't wait to sear big ole diver scallops in it. I've made a big pot of chili in it even. Drys everything great from delicious fried chicken, bone-in pork chops & perfectly seared 2" thick ribeye. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Twice

customer_reviews.title: Great product, seasoned well
customer_reviews.text: Have used this pan several times now and can say I am completely satisfied. Nothing sticks to it and clean-up has been easy. A light coating of oil and brief re-seasoning after each use and it looks like new. Some others have complained about the rough surface, but so far it hasn't caused any problems with the items I've cooked. I have one recipe for split roasted chicken that requires a high temperature of 475 and this pan worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a five star and have not even used it? It’s made in the United States of America. There were other skillets that were much cheaper made in China. I believe it’s worth the money. I have hand me downs of other Lodge cast iron, but not this size. I believe the oldest one I have is 70 Plus years, so I have used them for years. It’s great to have a company that’s been around for about 122 years. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Randy Larson

customer_reviews.title: Muscles required
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a huge cast iron pan that would feed a family of 5 then this is it. At 13.25” in diameter, it will go beyond the normal cooktop area. Be mindful that it is super heavy so moving it from cooktop to table or washing it in the sink may require some arm muscle.
customer_reviews.author: CeeMo

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy but cooks very well
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. My grandmother always cooked with cast iron and I reliving some of her fine cooking once again. Clean up is a snap, wipe out the pan, heat is up once again and rinse it under very hot tap water and let the steam do the cleaning. I then season the pan with a big drop of oil and it's ready for the next meal. At 11 pounds though, this pan is not for the frail. Cannot wait to use it the grill this coming summer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wells

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great skillet and bigger than I thought. Love the size since i'm usually cooking for 4 this has more than enough room especially coming from a 10" prior. Love that it's pretty seasoned.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband since he’s the cook. Easy to clean. We clean with “The Ringer” made to clean your cast irons with on harsh soap or detergents without stripping away your seasoning. I would recommend both this cast iron and “the ringer”.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C

customer_reviews.title: HUGE pan
customer_reviews.text: I like the pan, however I thought I ordered a 12" but turns out this one is 13.5" inside. A bit to big for my burners, but Im getting used to the great crispy food that this pan can deliver.
customer_reviews.author: BARB chapo

customer_reviews.title: If you want a cast iron skillet this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Mother's Day. She's always wanted a cast iron skillet. We were happy to see the last foundry making these in the US is Lodge and they're located in our home state, so that was cool to find out when we got it home. It's seasoned up nice and we used it almost every time we cook now. It's made to last a lifetime and I'm sure it will do just that. If you want a cast iron skillet this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: LOVE our Lodge Pre-Seasoned Skillet!!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Lodge Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Skillet! We have never owned one before. We decided on a Lodge product because of their excellent reputation. And they did not disappoint us. We are so glad we took a leap of faith and joined all others cooking and baking in Cast Iron Skillets. If you have never tried using Cast Iron Cookware, please do so and purchase a Lodge Product. These pans, skillets, and etc., do exactly as they say.
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: This pan brings out the Chef in you (and your food)
customer_reviews.text: This pan brings out the Chef in you (and your food) Great for meats, vegetables, eggs... Sear meat on the stovetop, finish in the oven. Juices reduce, sugars caramelize. Flavor, flavor, flavor. Bang! As Emeril would say.
customer_reviews.author: F Sean H

customer_reviews.title: Reliving my Childhood
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I'm learning to relive my childhood by going back to cast iron. I also have an induction cooktop so this is a bit of an adventure. So far things are going well but I did discover that the induction temp needs to be a bit lower than normal for the cast iron or things burn too quickly. The seasoning on the pan was ok but I had to reseason again as recommended by Lodge. So far it worked out well and with the addition of some olive oil things aren't sticking! Yay! Hopefully I will continue to enjoy using this pan for many years. Oh it is a tad on the heavy side!
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cast iron skillet!
customer_reviews.text: Used skillet in almost perfect condition. Great price and fast shipping too. I love cast iron pans and this size is awesome for cooking larger amounts at once
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very good except for pre-seasoning
customer_reviews.text: Good pan but pre-seasoning is lame. Ive been cooking in it regularly. Still can't cook eggs like my lodge griddle but it will get there. One tip I read and it runs true is that you must gradually heat these pans up. Turning up heat in hope of cooking faster just creates trouble. Patience.
customer_reviews.author: stanley

customer_reviews.title: Inappropriate packing and product defects
customer_reviews.text: These 2 pans were packed togther and resting on top of each other without any wrapping around them for protection. These are cast iron and heavy and they rubbing against each other because of the lack of appropriate packing materials. Also, there are multiple imperfections with both pans and a red residue on the griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Archibald

customer_reviews.title: The best pan!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is awesome, super durable and cooks up meals great! Best purchase hands down! Highly recommend switching to cast iron you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: C&L

customer_reviews.title: Great skillet!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a great value considering that it will last decades, the skillet alone weighs 10.5 lbs. Comes preseasoned, but I recommend that you season it again prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lee

customer_reviews.title: What could possibly go wrong?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and as advertised. I have other Lodge cast iron cookware, so I knew what to expect. I don't understand all the mystique around cast iron skillets. It is a skillet, for Pete's sake. I have been washing mine with soap and water for years. No disasters yet. What could possibly go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: N. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely pre season this on your own to make it truly non-stick but I love this pan. Big enough to cook for 5 people. Use it for eggs a lot, you can scramble 15 eggs at once.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Terrific pan but beware the size
customer_reviews.text: Lodge makes a great cast iron pan - this is my third (different sizes). But the advertising is a bit misleading on this one. This is a 10.5 inch pan with a 13 1/4 inch opening at the rim. That said, it's plenty big and I'm kind of glad it's smaller than I expected because its seriously heavy for cooking. Yes, not surprising for good cast iron but I wouldn't want heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl Silver

customer_reviews.title: Love my cast-iron!!
customer_reviews.text: This has become the most used and loved skillet in my kitchen! At first, I wasn't a fan, but I stuck with it and overtime the seasoning built up and made it truly non stick. The heat conduction is amazing, and it browns meats like a dream! I don't use it for anything with a lot of tomatoes in it (like chicken Parmesana) and I don't use it if I have to make a roux either, because I found doing both of those things screws up the seasoning. It is very large, but I cook for a crowd, so it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I cook almost everything in this pan! Love it! This is the first cast iron pan I’ve ever owned. Wish I had bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa White

customer_reviews.title: Love this cast iron pan!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this cast iron pan. It fits a good amount, cooks well and is holding up after about 15 uses so far.
customer_reviews.author: miranda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of preseasoned black iron skillets, Lodge is the way to go for top quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cast Iron Skillet!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. Wonderful size for cooking larger portions. Also great when frying. Cleans up easy and no issues seasoning.
customer_reviews.author: The Soldier's Wife

customer_reviews.title: The Standard
customer_reviews.text: A big, well-seasoned cast iron skillet is the kitchen standard for good cooking. It just works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Asbury

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Holds and distributed heat evenly. Would recommend if you need a large cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.author: Dog mother

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty skillet that cooks everything well.
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite skillet.We have been using it for some time now (over a year) and it is going strong. It is well seasoned, and we take good care of it. The heaviness of this skillet allows for great heat retention and durability. I use it about two times a week. Cleaning is easy since we bought a chain mail scrubber for it. I love this skillet for many types of cooking. Be aware, this is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Water Monkey

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN USA!!!
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN USA!!! That’s what sold me, and we love it! Can’t wait to buy more pieces. Plan on s#*t canning my Calphalon!
customer_reviews.author: Michele P.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan, when cared for properly will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: What a great pan. You have to care accordingly for this pan, very simple : keep dry, clean with out brushing and after apply a little oil.
customer_reviews.author: Odessit

customer_reviews.title: Pan-searing a steak in this skillet is delicious!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen in love with cast iron, because of this skillet. I have several food allergies, so I eat a lot of meat, and the steaks I’ve made on this skillet rival anything in a restaurant. I watched the YouTube video on cooking steak by Gordon Ramsey, and just followed the directions. I also think it’s great that Lodge skillets are made in the USA

customer_reviews.title: Oh the cast irony.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, especially if you need something to induce blunt force trama.
customer_reviews.author: talmadge t.

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Cast iron is the utensil I choose to cook many things. You can not go wrong with that choice. It cleans well and distributes the heat evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Lee Putnam

customer_reviews.title: No Returns allowed on damaged item
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive this item but noticed there was a chip that was coated over near the handle. I tried to return the item but Was told me returns are allowed. Ridiculous! It’s just going to rust out.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cast iron skillet and I love it! Easier to care for than I thought it would be.

customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE! But we love it. We needed a new cast iron skillet and I wanted to make sure it was a good one and this did not disappoint
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Pan seared steak!  Pick it up!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. I use it to sear meat which it does with a plum. It’s cast iron, so it is heavy....but if your not a girly man, buy it.

customer_reviews.title: pan
customer_reviews.text: high quality great pan, great price. very heavy but all cast iron is heavy. Highly recommend

customer_reviews.title: its hugh & heavy
customer_reviews.text: I just got them delivered and they are hugh and heavy. Which is what a good cast iron skillet is about. I haven cooked in it yet but I cant wait !!! Great price too. I ordered 2 !!!

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't rust so quickly if preseasoned
customer_reviews.text: Preseasoned is a lie. The skillet began to rust before it's first use.

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good service
customer_reviews.text: I use this several times a week. Great addition to our home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space we prepare food for 8 with ease!
customer_reviews.text: These are so well made and perfect for our very large family!

customer_reviews.title: Hands down my wife's favorite Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my wife's favorite Christmas present, other than the Tea kettle (Ovente 1.5L BPA-Free Glass Electric Kettle, Fast Heating with Auto Shut-Off and Boil-Dry Protection, Cordless, LED Light Indicator, Green (KG83G) ). Wife uses this skillet, every day.
customer_reviews.author: C. davis

customer_reviews.title: Great cooking surface area!
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas present for my sister and within a week she had already roasted a chicken with brussel sprouts and carrots and was moving on to menu number 2! Very well made, well seasoned, and great cooking surface area. I will definitely be buying another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: MDolphins_GSD_74

customer_reviews.title: I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE SMALLER (THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID, LOL)
customer_reviews.text: It was kinda too big but I'm going to keep and use it anyways. I currently bought the eight inch skillet from Lodge (first time owner) and waiting for the arrival. Seems to me I will buy more in the future just be sure you know the size you working with, you can't never have too much iron cast pans.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Green

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and food sticks!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived damaged and didn't appear to be treated properly. I've used lodge cast iron skillets for many years now and never have had problems with sticking. With this the sticking was exceptionally terrible even after preheating before cooking and also adding oil to skillet ahead of cooking. This was definitely not up to par with the lodge name.

customer_reviews.title: Riding the Gravy Train
customer_reviews.text: We love this skillet. Does anyone know how much gravy you can make in this thing? A lot. That's how much, Awesome.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan. Cooks evenly and cleans up really well.

customer_reviews.title: Love the pan
customer_reviews.text: Love the pan. It should come with a lid, or make finding the proper lid easy. I shouldn't have to research, dig, ponder, measure and read reviews to find the lid that fits. Are you listening Lodge?

customer_reviews.title: and the 15 is great on top of my wood stove or in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is about the biggest skillet you can use on a normal size stovetop range element without the heat being too uneven. I have a 12" and a 15" as well, and the 15 is great on top of my wood stove or in the oven, but not so much on the range. Lodge rules!

customer_reviews.text: when you get it, season it yourself. after that all good, i did take off the rough texture.

customer_reviews.title: Its very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Its very heavy but cast iron pans usually are. I bought the largest one because I wanted to make pizza in a pan. Turned out perfect. My grandmother and mom grew up using these and in my mind, the food always tasted better when cooked in a cast iron pan.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Ohlman

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Product
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal cast iron pan! Gave this to my mom for Christmas and she's been loving it ever since. Make sure to season the pan so that you get all the benefits a cast iron can give your cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Joce & Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Sticky, heavy, impractical
customer_reviews.text: Really did not like this product. Way too heavy (more than usual for cast iron) and it sticks badly. The sticking and the weight make it a huge chore to wash - I used it once and it’ll be going in a closet somewhere now, I won’t take the time to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Skillet.. But I love it.. Big enough for everything I want to Fry!! Own Several other sizes from lodge, never had an issue. I did my own Seasoning when I got it, and The seasoning is almost perfect... the skillit is.. have to get the seasoning just the way I want it yet.. Got it really quick
customer_reviews.author: George Starr

customer_reviews.title: You aren't going to a find a better skillet than this
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to mess up a cast iron skillet, and Lodge has not messed up this cast iron skillet. This is exactly what it's supposed to be. product_meta.title: Lodge 13.25 Pre Seasoned Inch Cast Iron Skillet. Large Classic Cast Iron Skillet for Family Size Meals
product_meta.description: Size:13.25"The Lodge Cast Iron 13.25-inch Skillet is a multi-functional cookware that works wonders with slow-cooking recipes and all your favorite foods. Fry up a chicken, saute vegetables or bake an apple crisp in this generous 13.25-inch pan that features two handles for heavy lifting and two subtle side lips for pouring. Cast iron loves a campfire, a stovetop, or an oven, and can slow-cook foods without scorching. It retains heat well so you can sear meat at higher temperatures and will keep your delicious meals warm for a long time. Whether used in a kitchen or camp, theses virtually indestructible cookware should last for generations. Made of cast iron, this Skillet evenly distributes heat from the bottom through the sidewalls. Sporting a stylish black color, the cast iron Skillet looks good in most kitchens and it doubles up as an excellent source of nutritional iron. Cast Iron, like your grandmother used, still ranks as one of the best cooking utensils ever made. It gives you a nearly non-stick surface, without the possible harmful fumes generated by preheating chemically treated nonstick cookware. The American-based company, Lodge, has been fine-tuning its construction of rugged, cast-iron cookware for more than a century.
